results.title: One in a million
results.creator_credit: Government of Tasmania Department of Film Production
results.brief_description: An experiment in the fluoridation of drinking water by Beaconsfield Council, Tasmania. The local chemist was the driving force in having the Council add the necessary one part fluoride to a million parts of water. Comparisons over the years of teeth of children brought up on Council’s fluoridated water supply and the teeth of children from outlying areas using tank water amply justifies fluoridation. The benefit to general health, cost and lack of adverse effects on persons or industry.

results.title: One hundred harvests
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Robert Hesselschwerdt
results.brief_description: A historical review of the work done on cereal breeding since the establishment of the Department of Agriculture in 1872. Includes shots of many old farming implements housed in the Historical Museum of Jeparit. Shows stages in the development of new varieties of wheat at Werribee Research Farm. Made in connection with centenary of the Department.

results.title: One hundred entertainments
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of China”.
Based in Sian, on the old Silk Road to the west, the Shensi Provincial Acrobatic Troupe is skilled at their art, and loved by the people who see them perform. The Troupe’s tradition goes back two thousand years. It spends as much as eight months of the year on tour.

results.title: One hundred and one dalmatians = 101 dalmations
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney, Wolfgang Reitherman, Hamilton Luske and Clyde Geronimi
results.brief_description: Pongo and Perdita settle into their owner’s home and become the proud parents of fifteen beautiful dalmation puppies. Cruella De Vil thinks that the litter would make a perfect dogskin coat and with the help of her henchmen, steals the puppies. Pongo and Perdita and their canine friends, embark on a dangerous rescue mission, and at last are reunited with their children and more dalmations! Based on the novel by Dodie Smith. Features the voices of Rod Taylor, Betty Lou Gerson, Cate Bauer, Lisa Daniels, Ben Wright and others.

results.title: One hundred and forty days under the world
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Kell Fowler
results.brief_description: Deals with one summer’s work by New Zealand scientists in the Ross Dependency in the Antarctic, and the exploration of some of the last unmapped regions. Shows expeditions designed to gather scientific data on the weather, animal life in the area and shifting ice patterns.

results.title: One hour to zero
results.creator_credit: Charles Barker Films, Jean Wadlow and Jeremy Summers
results.brief_description: A teenage boy in trouble with his father and the law runs away from home with a friend. While he is away, his village is evacuated due to the threat of an explosion at a nearby nuclear research station. The boys return to their empty village and encounter a bank robber who pursues them into a mining site. Meanwhile, at the regional assembly point, the boys are discovered to be missing and a search is launched. A race against time and danger commences, to locate the boys avert an explosion and apprehend the robber.

results.title: One hand clapping
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Joan Henson
results.brief_description: Noise pollution is a scourge of our time no less than are the visible forms that contaminate our environment. From the jangle of the alarm clock to the din of downtown, noise assails us throughout the day. The way the film depicts this aural enemy provides overpowering, at times amusing, evidence that here, too, the time has come to call a halt. Cast includes Ghislaine Phaneuf, Don Scanlan, Griffith Brewer, Dave Broadfoot, Sonny Cullen, Don Arioli, Judith Gault.

results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Roland Beckett and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: An examination of the reactions of a career army man who is considering resigning to take advantage of an attractive offer to join a commercial organisation. Stars Bill Hunter as Major Archer.

results.title: One giant step
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Film shows how new technology is being used in the rehabilitation of the physically disabled. The range of aids available, from environmental control systems to communications aids are examined
